intro: Weingartia tiraquensis, commonly known as the Tiraquén weingartia, is a species of cactus native to Argentina. It belongs to the Cactaceae family and is characterized by its compact, globular shape and short, ribbed stems. The plant produces clusters of small, white flowers during the spring and summer months. It is well adapted to arid environments, with spines that provide protection and reduce water loss. Weingartia tiraquensis is a popular choice for rock gardens and indoor collections due to its hardiness and attractive appearance.
